title: The Malaysia Act
description: Category: statute | Source: https://laws.moj.gov.jm/library/statute/the-malaysia-act | Legal areas: Citizenship and Nationality

provisions.title: Section 2
Section 3
provisions.content:
3.-(1) On and after the commencement of this Act, all Operation
law which, whether being a rule of law or a provision of of     existing
                                                              law.
an Act of Parliament or of any other enactment or
instrument whatsoever, is in force on the date of such
commencement or has been passed or made before that
date and comes into force thereafter, shall, unless and until
provision to the contrary is made by Parliament or some
other authority having power in that behalf, and subject to
the following provisions of this section, have the same
operation in relation to the Federation, to any of the States
of the Federation, and to persons and things belonging to
or connected with the Federation or any of the States
thereof, as it would have apart from this subsection if the
new States had not become included in the Federation and
\
    2                         MALA YSlA ACT
        Her Majesty’s sovereignty and jurisdiction in respect of the
        new States had not been relinquished.
                (2) The Minister may, by order, make such adapta-
        tions in any enactment passed before or after the date of
        commencement of this Act, or in any instrument having
        effect under any such enactment, as appear to him necessary
        or expedient in consequence of the new States becoming
        included in the Federation; and any such order may, though
        made after the commencement of this Act, be made so
        as to have effect from the date of such Commencement.
                (3) Every order made under subsection (2) shall be
        subject to negative resolution.
